item.title: Privacy and data collection
item.description: Access logs This website runs on Nginx, which collects access logs by default. The logs include the IP address and the user agent of the visitor, time and date of the visit, and the exact pages visited. The user agent may include operating system, browser, browser engine and their respective versions. Example yodaimperium.de 133.74.20.69 - - [13/Aug/2022:18:00:00 +0000] “GET /posts/helloworld/ HTTP/2.0” 200 2224741 “https://yodaimperium.de/posts/helloworld/" “Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.

item.title: yodaimperium.de
item.description: In this article I’m going to explain the underlying architecture of this website. I think I’ve found a very cool way to deploy just by pushing to the GitHub Repository without exposing any SSH keys, etc.. However, I took a lot of inspiration from this guy called Wolfgang’s Channel on YouTube. TL;DR It is created with Hugo and deployed via GitHub Actions to a RaspberryPi running nginx. Static Website Generation This very website is created with Hugo and the Gokarna Theme.
